text: Everybody talks about the cost of intelligence going to zero, but it's not actually going to zero. It's going down to a low number, but concurrently the fleets of agents are getting so much bigger so quickly. And and you know, we saw earlier in this pod too, expand the context window to hundreds of millions of tokens and run many many iterations to get rid of the hallucinations. Those forces are going in the other direction and it's working far better than anyone thought it would. And so it's very unlikely that the cost of intelligence is going to go to anywhere near zero. Everybody's going to want more intelligence and more intelligence and more. So, there's going to be an acute shortage and you're going to be starved of
